website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive trundle option that can be rolled easily under most beds.
pros: Does not need a box spring
Made for use with many beds
Mattress sits on the inside of the frame to give extra clearance
Simple product will meet your needs without breaking the budget
cons: There are no brakes on the casters
This model can be more difficult than others to put together

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Versitle
customer_reviews.text: I needed a twin over queen bunk in a modern style, and I believe it does not exist. So I paired this with a low profile queen bed underneath and it works great. I have it in a rental that gets a lot of abuse. After 2 years of adults climbing up and down, it still looks almost new and it is holding up great. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great frame, steps are painful.
customer_reviews.text: Great frame! The full size carries me and my wife, combined weight of around 270 pounds. Like many other reviews, the stairs are painful and hard. I put pipe insulation over them and it's super soft. I also put the same insulation on the corners to prevent it from banging up against the wall. The frame does rock a bit while climbing up, but if braced properly against the wall or corner, with pipe insulation, it decreases the rocking by 60%.
customer_reviews.author: Superkid

customer_reviews.title: easy enough for a mum to build alone and it ...
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded my expectations... Makes the room look so much bigger, easy enough for a mum to build alone and it is so sturdy. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am actually surprised at how good of quality it is
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old son is 5'8'' and 220lbs. He put this together himself and flys up and down it with ease. I am actually surprised at how good of quality it is. I thought I would need to add bracing, but none needed so far. Here is a NOTE for anyone not used to loft beds. We ended up installing a LED strip light under the ben above the desk area. It gets really dark there..even with a PC monitor shining.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN P.

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed...
customer_reviews.text: Putting it all together does take a good number of hours. However the payoff is freaking awesome! I would recommend buying pool noodles/zip ties and cutting to size for the ladders. As far as use goes, I occasionally check screws for tightening. There are light squeeks but that's the worst of it. I stand about 72 inches tall (6 feet) and I weigh about 260ish lbs. It handles me very well considering. Getting used to climbing into a bunk style bed took some getting used to but I'm good now. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Heyward

customer_reviews.title: Fix the ladder w/ a pool noodle:)
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy for the price. I didn't have the funds to buy a wooden bunk bed set so I purchased this to go over top of my daughters full size bed. She's super happy with it and likes to sleep up there when she has friends spend the night. Purchased with a memory foam mattress and it comfortable. Fixed the ladder issue with a pool noodle.
customer_reviews.author: C Skinner

customer_reviews.title: A+, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, convenient, inexpensive, sturdy, space-saving. Pros: It's full size and spacious to comfortably fit adults It has two ladders, one on either side. This gives you better options for exiting and entering regardless of where it is situated in your bedroom, and ease of access for a second person Tons of extra space under the bed!!! Cons: The ladder rungs are a bit hard on the soles of your feet I wish this had an opening where the ladder meets the mattress so you don't have to straddle the rails every time you climb on
customer_reviews.author: LanguidLady

customer_reviews.title: Great loft bed for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bed! It isn't the most sturdy piece of furniture I've ever bought but it can hold an eight year old and her friend with no issue. It took around three hours for me and my husband to put together. We bought a closet maid cube shelf to store stuff underneath and it has made my daughters room so much more organized. I would definitely buy this again for another kid.
customer_reviews.author: Erin E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product !!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy enough room for a queen, sturdy, modern. Just alittle noise when movement but worth the buy. Give the room move space.
customer_reviews.author: Lingmeosha

customer_reviews.title: amazing for small spaces ❤️
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much! Plenty of room on the top and on the bottom. I would recommend getting a bedside buddy shelf to hold your phone/ drink. So far this bed in amazing and is saving so much space!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Leibfried

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be recalled! Theses beds are NOT safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed because of good reviews. And also had my fiancé buy one for his daughter as well. I am convinced that people were not being truthful in their reviews or the supplier changed their building materials. The very first night of use several bolt SNAPPED off and shot across the room while my daughter was in it! This bed is not worth the metal it's made from and the bolts are clearly fragile/cheap or defective. So far FOUR bolt heads have snapped off, this is a severe safety issue and should be recalled. I Wish my fiancé and I had NOT purchased these cheap, flimsy, DANGEROUS beds!!!
customer_reviews.author: NML

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Pretty easy assemble
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and in good packaging. Instructions were pretty easy to follow. Assembly was a breeze except for those little gray things you snap in to keep the mattress support bars in place ;) Those were a pain but not a big deal. It's sturdy and looks great in the room. My 22 year old daughter is using this loft bed, so its suitable for more than just kids. Good buy. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: White Rock

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Gor this for my girls (age 11& 4). I put a twin bed and tv under for my youngest she loves it. And my oldest loves having her own space. The latter isn't the best on the feet (uncomfortable). But overall a good product. Assembled it by myself in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last February for my 2 boys. With in 2 months screws were falling out of the latter. We were constantly rescrewing and tightening them back up. By the 6 month mark the latter was completely done for. My 13 year old (110 lbs) has to use a chair and jump up to the top bunk. This morning while I was in making the beds I gave it a good shake to see how sturdy it is and screws fell out!! Looks like I'm shopping for new bunkbeds... It's not safe and someone is going to get hurt!! What a waist of money!!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: It supports me just fine, I wouldn't recommend building the entire bed on ...
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to build, but I am 6ft tall and 200lbs solid. It supports me just fine, I wouldn't recommend building the entire bed on the floor and flipping it upright, as it might not clear the ceiling. When almost done with more than half the bed, be sure to flip upright and finish assembling. But it is an awesome bed and I can sit underneath and watch tv perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rafi Wadud

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed! Good Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The bed is awesome! I was able to fit my queen sized mattress into the loft area with very few alterations; we just left the side rails off. The bed is also very sturdy. My only complaint: the stairs are somewhat difficult and uncomfortable to use, but I'm sure would be fine for a child. I've created an alternate staircase which makes it much easier for me to get up there. I didn't have much room in my bedroom prior to purchasing this item, and now I have so much more room for activities 😆
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old granddaughter refused to sleep on this because it moved way to much
customer_reviews.text: I was so careful to go over the reviews of loft beds. I read where this one was used by a college student who loved it. My granddaughter totally disagreed with that student. We set it up per the directions. It was not sturdy. We attached it to the wall. It still made noise and moved a lot when on it. My 10 year old granddaughter never felt save on it. I am not a person to give negative reviews. This bed changed that for me. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: jc.mom

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy open box
customer_reviews.text: First and last time buying an opened box. Got this. And it's my fault for waiting until today when I needed it to put it together. It can't be assembled. It's missing half of the parts. It's missing 2 of the main frame and 5 of the center support bars. I can't do anything with this but place it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: shondatoneil

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than local, plus free delivery!!
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is I had to put it together. I'm getting lazy and I don't like to build furniture. That being said, it really was easier than anything I have built from the "scandanvian" furniture store. It doesn't squeak, the included futon mattress is actually really nice, and it's a great price. Just a heads up, it arrives in two separate packages (or even deliveries as in my case). I was worried the mattress was left out since it wasn't in the box, but it arrived the next day. Amazing price when we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great, once put together properly!
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to put together mainly because I didn't pay attention to the where the ladder holes were so I had to go back a few steps. Instructions weren't hard to follow, but not all parts were labeled with the corresponding letter, but still easy enough to figure out. Sturdy and hardly any noise when mattresses were in. Some small areas of rust on some of the guardrails, which I wasn't happy about because of the price, but not enough to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Z

customer_reviews.title: She could not be happier. The rooms in our house are teeny tiny
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed for my daughter's 12th b-day. She could not be happier. The rooms in our house are teeny tiny, but this has given her the space she needs to feel comfortable! It was super simple to put together...literally one of the easiest things my husband and I have ever tackled. We plan to purchase another for our son! Beyond pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Hayls

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but the steps needed padding
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and relatively easy to put together. 6 year old hasn't wanted to sleep in parent's bed since. One thing we needed to add was some split tubing over the ladder steps; they hurt my son's feet and I was afraid he was going to slip and bust a tooth. We split some rubber tubing from the hardware store and extended each piece to the right of each step so that it can't spin. Helped a lot. Also, I recommend choosing a mattress that is not very deep if this bunk is for a younger child so that the railings are high enough to actually function as a safety feature. Please read online for height guidelines.
customer_reviews.author: N. King

customer_reviews.title: Needs more support beams.
customer_reviews.text: If this Loft Bed wasnt so wobbly and that the ladders were placed in the middle instead of the corner, this would be a 5 star product. Instead, its barely a 4 star. Every little movement shakes like there’s an earthquake and in the middle of the night, ( when nature calls and you’re half awake) you’re constantly looking for the first step of the ladder. Too bad there isn't a cross bar in the middle to help. I simply purchased a 4 step stool to ease egress process. I am renting out one of the rooms at the house and my tenant was so happy that i purchased the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jake from state farm

customer_reviews.title: Great bed, sturdy, but painful ladder rungs.
customer_reviews.text: This bed went together with minimal issue. It is quite sturdy for the price! I had already read the reviews saying the ladder rungs were painful for their kids. To be honest I kind of dismissed them. But they were right, especially since you are getting in and out of bed with no shoes on. I cut some pool noodles to cover them and it helped. It just doesnt look as nice with rainbow colored foam on the rungs. I actually contemplating building a wooden ladder and hanging it on the outside of the bed to replace them essentially.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bunk Night Stand
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some kind of shelf to put books and an alarm clock on for my sons bunk bed and figured i would give this a try. It came in two pieces but is super easy to put together, and does not require any tools. There is a slight incline on the shelf so things would roll towards the basket, not sure if mine is bent or if that is what is intended. It seems really durable and will hold a decent amount of weight. If you have a metal bunk bed with the round rails take a look at this to see if it would fit, but i would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES his new bed. He thinks his room is so cool with his desk underneath. It's not as bad as I thought it would be changing the sheets. I don't like climbing on top because I feel like I'm going to break it. It does sway a little bit when adults climb up there, but it does support the weight. The only thing that I don't like is that there isn't an opening where the ladder goes up and he has to climb over the bars. Other than that, it's great. There was a small dent in the front of the bed, but it's not too noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Designed By Satan
customer_reviews.text: This took two people SEVEN HOURS to assemble. I am surprised we are still friends after putting together this rickety, cheaply made frame. Nothing like the picture, there were multiple extra pieces (??) and so much plastic and packaging. The frame is very wobbly and feels unsafe to lie on. The frame is made of thin metal tubes and literally took FOREVER to put together. Ripoff!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Short-term Extra Space on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: This bed took a highly skilled carpenter 2 hours to assemble with an electric drill. It is mildly squeaky and it does sway a bit if you’re climbing in or turning over. The ladder is painful to step on because it’s just metal bars. It’s challenging to get from the metal bars into the bed over the railing. I think it’s a great bed if you’re in a pinch and need something affordable that you’re only going to use for a few years. Also, the carpenter who set up the bed told me I will need to retighten the screws periodically. The extra space it saves me is worth its quirks.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, I love it
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 7 months now. I put it together myself so it took me a few hours. there are a lot of parts but the instructions were clear enough that I was able to put it together myself piece by piece. There's plenty of room underneath it for storage or whatever you want to do with it. I created a little sitting area. It feels very sturdy to sleep on. I love my bed
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than I thought, but wobbly...
customer_reviews.text: I love what this has done to my room--I now have more floor space and this makes my room feel bigger than it is. I am a female with a smaller figure, but I managed to put this frame together by myself in a few hours, which means it is not difficult to assemble. Being small, I didn't think I would have issues with the bed breaking down on me. It definitely is quite sturdy. However, it wobbles a bit more than I thought it would, so I don't sleep well because I feel uneasy when I lay in bed. I will be returning this frame because it just isn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: gsue

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a nightmare to assemble. Nearly 4 hours, many swear words, bruises, and pulled muscles later, I finally got it finished. I did all of it alone except for two steps which require either two people or one person with at least three arms. I’m also not a handy or mechanically inclined person, though, so someone else may have an easier go of it. It’s quite wobbly so I do wish it was sturdier. I will be using the provided brackets to anchor into the wall because of this, but that was something I was hoping to avoid needing. For the price, I’d recommend it, but if you’ve got a bigger budget, maybe buy something a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: C Bass

customer_reviews.title: This bed is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this bed for about 8 months. It wasn't that hard to assemble, but it did take some time; there are a lot of individual pieces to put together. It is very sturdy.My kids climb up and down with no shaking or wobbling of the bed. The bookshelf is great as a space saver in a small bedroom. I haven't used the desk - I mainly chose this for the extra shelves. Im sure the desk is fine though. I knocked off one star because a little bit of the white paint is chipping off in some places and that is annoying. Overall though, it's a good bed - especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amber L.T .

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: You know the old saying; you get what you pay for. Even for a cheap bed, it's not true. This is absolute garbage, please don't waste your money. I knew it would be cheaply made but the screw holes don't line up well, some aren't even the right diameter for the screws. It is not sturdy at all and im not sure how long we will be able tonuse them. We bought two of the for our 7 and 10 year olds and I'm ready to put both in a dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy, inexpensive loft bed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive option for loft beds. They were easy to assemble and are sturdy. I read reviews that the steps were hard on the feet so I bought some inexpensive bicycle handlebar tape and some white electrical tape and wrapped the steps with it. It is now soft on the feet and less slippery. You can buy the handlebar tape for around $9 for four rolls. I used 7 rolls. The kids love having room underneath for playing. If you are looking for a an inexpensive loft bed I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I was wondering whether this would be sturdy enough for the 160-pound, twenty-five year old guy who is using it, and it is. It shakes a bit when he rolls over, but that's because we didn't anchor it to the wall (we have just the bed, not the desk underneath). The metal seems sturdy enough -- we've been using it a month now and nothing has bent or bowed. The bright white finish looks great. Assembled by one person. Took a few hours, but it wasn't overly challenging. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KVT

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it! She says the ladder kinda hurts her feet but I plan to pad them. She’s 84lbs and the bed does wiggle a bit when she’s on it but not to the point I’m concerned about it. My husband plans to anchor it to the wall. Other then that I’m very happy with it. I needed to open up her room to give her more floor space and this did the job!
customer_reviews.author: April Otto

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bunk exactly what we needed! Great price too
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed for my growing 10 yo twin boys... Room is too small for two beds so a sturdy bunk was exactly what I was looking for to replace the wooden bunk beds they've had since they were 4. The bed arrived this week so we knew what we were doing on Saturday - took us about 2.5 hours to put together - really easy and very happy with the end result! Bed frame is sturdy and seems really safe which is probably the most important feature to all of us right. Price was great and the boys slept great in it last night 👍
customer_reviews.author: Heather B

customer_reviews.title: Nice product with organized instructions for assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Very organized, detailed instructions for assembly. Everything is numbered/labeled to match diagrams. The frame feels sturdy and durable. My only comment is they should have made the ladders able to pull out at an angle..they are a bit uncomfortable to climb, especially if you have a tall kid. We resorted to a step ladder instead. No storage space so I’m not sure why that is an option to give stars for. Overall I like it. We will see how it goes when changing bedding as getting up there is not the most comfortable for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.

customer_reviews.title: Comes in a million pieces, but ends up being a nice bed!
customer_reviews.text: Well holy cow... There's only 10,000 pieces to this bed... And is not for the faint of heart. I'm a single mother and only had a ten and seven year old to help me. Took me four hours to finish it. The mattress I have for it is a 9 inch, which I now regret, as it is at the very top of the railing. But over all, it does provide a lot of extra space to the room, which is what I was going for. Here's hoping I never have to dismantle it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Studdard

customer_reviews.title: Beware. Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!!! DO NOT BUY!!! I bought this twin size loft bed for my 6 year old son and it is tiny. He is not able to utilize the space underneath uncomfortably. It's mostly for storage. Also this bed is very very shaky and rickety. Every time he goes on and off, I can hear the bed shaking. There is also too much room for a twin mattress. There is a lot of gap between the rail and the mattress. I worry about my son getting stuck and so I have to fill the gap with padding so he does not fall in the gap.
customer_reviews.author: Momwitswagger

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bed. He is 6 so he was a little scared of going up and down at first because there is no gap by the ladders to get over the railing. But he now loves the bed more than anything! He thinks it’s incredible. Lots of reviews said it was hard to put together but I (mom) did it myself in just a few hours and this was after I made every possible mistake first. Lol. Make sure that you leave the screws holding the base a little loose until the slats are put in then tighten to avoid any fitting issues. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome space saver
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son slowly put this loft bed together in a couple of hours. I bought the full size frame for our 14 year old son for several reasons. First, it is bigger and comfier for a 5'9 growing boy. Second, his L-shaped desk fits perfectly underneath. It has a ladder on both sides. He likes it because it gives him lots of space. There's no way his desk and bed would fit in his room seperately. Our ceiling heights are 8 feet high so he can sit up and has a bit of space. He says it's a bit squeeky but knows it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ambie87

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and put off assembling the trundle for over a week. I thought those plastic snaps that hold the bars in place would be a real pain. They must have changed the design of the snaps based on the reviews, as I had no problems whatsoever! Took me longer to get all the parts out of the packaging than it did to assemble it! Fit perfectly under my grandchildren's metal tube frame bunk bed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Bouret

customer_reviews.title: Different from What's Listed
customer_reviews.text: The bed I received is the loft bed with shelving underneath, not the one with the workstation. I like the bed and it holds my weight (I am an adult) just fine when I want to take a nap or read! It is a little wobbly, but it's to be expected. I fit a huge beanbag underneath and can lay comfortably there, even my 6'0" tall husband can lay comfortably in the space below. The desk is simple, so I just use it as a table to hold my printer and Xerox paper. It looks great and is sturdy for the great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M. Dorn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but Need Help
customer_reviews.text: My son, my husband and I put this together together. While it was easy to assemble, it would’ve been difficult doing it solo. I recommend having someone (at least one person) help you to just hold railings. My son wanted this bed so he could put his gaming computer under the bed. He loves it and fits comfortably. For reference, my son is 16, 5’11” & 180lbs. We added an 8” Twin XL cool gel memory foam mattress that is snug but fits.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lil Makeup

customer_reviews.title: This product is flimsy and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This bed tray couldn't be put over a standard hospital bed bedrail. The basket had to face the inside of the bed and that was not practical. It also has sharp metallic edges that scratched my 83-year-old mother. The basket itself is so narrow that I now have it hanging over a chair to hold napkins and a brush and comb. DO NOT waste your money on this useless product!!
customer_reviews.author: houstonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but after a few months screws are popping out
customer_reviews.text: Great overall quality. My only issues were installation was a bit of pain unless do in certain order due to height of bed and room, which directions didn't take into account. Also the plugs that hold support bars in place require lots of force to put in which hurts your finger or thumb tips after first couple. ****Update**** After only a few months of use the ladder screws are popping out on their own causing a health hazard as my son almost fell to ground.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R Jean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. A queen bed frame fits underneath with plenty of space to spare for narrow nightstands. Putting it together was a breeze with two bottles of wine by your side. I was able to assemble this together with a girlfriend. Easy enough for 2 tipsy girls to put together. It is a little wobbly so I will need to anchor the bed to the wall to secure that down. Get it, you wont regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy G

customer_reviews.title: Many Defects! Inspect thoroughly before you build.
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this with my 8 year old. It took a while, but we were able to do it without any problems. However, the more of the pieces I pulled out of the box, the more frustrated I got. Many of the pieces already have blistering/peeling paint. I don't think it will impact the usefulness of the bed, but it is really frustrating to open a brand new box to find damaged goods. If it didn't weigh so much and we weren't partially into building it, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complicated assembly
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is very time consuming, even with 2 people helping. The bed squeaks a bit when a child climbs it. Very tall, so unless you have a tall ceiling or a short mattress you won't be able to sit up in bed. The thin, metal bars on the ladder to climb up are uncomfortable to do in bare feet. The loft bed is a nice option to save floor space. The space under the bed is not enough to stand up in, except for a young child, so it is better used for furniture to go in. Overall decent bed for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Paint chipping
customer_reviews.text: Its been two weeks since we’ve had this loft bed, my son loves it and it seems pretty sturdy. The only complaint i have is that the white paint is already chipping off. The interesting part is that its cracking and chipping on areas that i wouldn’t expect it to, like on the latter but on the under side of the step on the latter. I would expect it to chip where my son is stepping. But it leads me to think that the paint quality was not good bc if he steps on it, it seems its creating pressure and it chips and cracks on the underside. Underneath the white paint is a black metal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish...but someone forgot to put an opening at the top.
customer_reviews.text: The bed is stylish and sleek as far as loft beds come... HOWEVER, what I don’t like and failed to realize, was the fact there’s no opening at the top of either ladder. And that’s not convenient or safe, (in my opinion), for my 8yr old to climb into bed. He agrees! It makes it a pain in the *** to be perfectly honest. But overall, it’s a nice bed and looks great in the room. Oh, and yes, as others have said, the ladder is most definitely uncomfortable to climb with bare feet.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Once it’s together it’s the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could have a spot to nap in my gaming room. Under the loft I have my small IKEA Lack table, 32” tv, small plastic drawers, and a LoveSac MovieSac. I assembled it myself and you really need another person. I almost broke it because I was stubborn and wanted to put it together before my husband got home. I really love it though. Definitely worth it to save on the space.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a has a wobble I can't get rid of.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter does love her bed. It allows her to have a nice little studio underneath. What I didn't like about the bed was that the setup time took about 4 hours for us. The directions were missing from the box. Thank God I was smart enough to check Amazon. The seller uploads the directions on the site. We tightened every screw but the bed has a little wobble when my 7-year-old goes up the ladder. I can also hear the bed wobble at night. We know we screws are right. The wobble is something I don't like.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki G.

customer_reviews.title: Terrifying
customer_reviews.text: This bed is not as sturdy as it should be. It wobbles every time you climb the ladder or move in bed slightly. It is terrifying. I hope it holds up, but if it doesn't, you can bet your ass I'm returning it. It was also terrible to assemble; things didn't fit the way they should, we couldn't get screws into some areas because it just didn't line up. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: It’ll do for now.
customer_reviews.text: I have to climb up to make my son’s bed, and it actually comes off the ground when I climb on it. The ladder is so painful to climb on; we are trying to figure out something to make it more comfortable for him and myself. Took a while to put together, and the little plastic pieces you put in to keep the bars from moving are not easy to put in, in the least. I wish I could have gotten him a solid wood loft bed, but this will do. He hasn’t had it long and the bolts are coming loose already. It’s just a “MEH” product.
customer_reviews.author: Shania

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: My Sons room is semi small and this be was perfect. He has space all over the room since he wanted a gaming set up and his desk and stuff took alot of space. The bed itself is a full size and its easy to assemble and you need two ppl to do it, the pieces are big. The bed put together does wobble a bit not alot, but dont expect kids to jump and play around on it too much since it does wobble alot left and right. thats the only issue. I recommend putting pool floaties on the steps since they hurt to go up, super thin step.
customer_reviews.author: Alba

customer_reviews.title: This trundle was perfect to slide under my son’s bed and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: This trundle was perfect to slide under my son’s bed and it was very easy to put together. We also bought a bunkie board to support the 6 inch foam mattress that was bought separately and it was just the right height. I just wish the trundle had some short support rails to keep the mattress from sliding off the trundle.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Good if you want something temporary and cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty good for the price but the stairs are crazy thin! We got it because we knew it was a rectangular shape without extra side stairs or anything that would take up more space than we had. In the end, we had to purchase an actual portable ladder for my son on the side and also hacked the stairs with swim noodles. The space underneath is super big for a young kid. My son had a bean bag, a dresser, and lots of toys underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy to assemble. I have assembled many pieces of furniture alone with no problem. This piece I had the assistance of my 17 amd 13 year old, it was still a pain. Once we did get it together, it took 3 hours, I have absolutely no complaints. It was bought for my 5'9" 170 pound 13 year old. It's sturdy, and gives alot of extra floor area to his room. Hes able to fit a desk under the bed along with a small bookshelf and that's a huge help. I would definitely recommend buying this and would buy another one. Do not tighten the bolts and screws completely until you have it all together.
customer_reviews.author: naomiwatson82

customer_reviews.title: Some shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the bolt holes needed the threads to be re tapped. ( 1/4-20 threads ) Some welds appear to be almost non existent. After a few sleepovers by the grandson we will see if the welds hold. Some paint was chipped on arrival, appeared to be from the factory not in shipment. I used star lock washers on all bolts, non supplied in kit. May not be the best Loft Bed but would probably purchase another for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: R J Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: So easy to understand how to install with all those numbers labeld on each peice. Works great very sturdy. Put a 12 in matress in it even though it says not to. Plenty of protection still left with the guard rail. Inexpensive but does a great job. My oldest slid her bed underneath and then later on when my youngest moves out she can take it with her and put a desk under it
customer_reviews.author: Airbear08

customer_reviews.title: Possibly More Suitable for Older Kids
customer_reviews.text: Bed needs 2 people to assemble. It wasn’t very difficult, just need more than 2 hands at times. Very sturdy. Biggest thing to note: This bed does not have an opening at the top of the ladders!! So, for smaller children, this could be a difficult adjustment. My grandson was a little afraid at first. Kids must climb over the railing, and into the actual bed. With a mattress, it leaves little room for error. Just be mindful. Otherwise, great bed. Probably more suited for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: EVY

customer_reviews.title: Definitely read reviews! Sometimes cheap isn’t the best.
customer_reviews.text: So, for the price it’s a pretty good deal. Although, i would definitely take measurements and give about 8 additional inches. The way that it’s set up, you have to literally climb OVER the railings because there is no opening where the ladder is. Also, you can’t change the position of the ladders so now that I’ve put it all together... my daughter can’t use her ceiling fan because it’s in the way. Also, some of the screws are stripped. I wouldn’t purchase again but since I’ve already taken 3 hours putting it together, I’m not taking it apart for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Brittni

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile trundle, but casters do not swivel
customer_reviews.text: This trundle is a great low profile design, but I was bummed to discover that the wheels do not swivel. They are fixed and ONLY allow you to wheel the bed from side to side. So you cannot wheel the trundle under the bed long-ways (I wanted to put it long ways under a queen size bed. I contacted the company by phone and by email asking if they can replace the casters. I was told I would hear back in 24-48 hours but it has been about a week and I have not yet heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No space to enter or get off
customer_reviews.text: product came in finally. I had help putting this together. It took 2 hrs for 2 guys to put it together. Not too bad if your good at following instruction. After we assemble it. We notice that there is no entrance or exit space. I thought we got the wrong product. But i looked at the other reviewers picture. There were really no space to get in. So my daughter have to go over the rails at top. I guess she just have to get use to it?
customer_reviews.author: oliver

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and sturdy. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to put together, and great for a kid's bedroom. However, if your get the accessories to attach to this bed, the instructions will let you down. Only one of the crossbeams has holes in the right spots for the attachments, and the instructions don't clarify this. Also, the ladder rungs are so thin that they hurt your feet. Lots of people on ebay are selling homemade rung covers to remedy this, and its not a big deal, but something to consider before buying.
customer_reviews.author: phuonom

customer_reviews.title: Love this bed frame!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bed frame! Arrived a few days earlier than anticipated. Space saver for bedroom - giving our son a great place to hang out. Installation was easy. One person, a few hours from unboxing to cleanup. Would have gone quicker with a helper. Ceilings are 8’ - had to install vertical braces while holding up the ends vs laying on floor. This is not noted in the directions - but can not install vertical bars and then stand up with 8’ ceilings. Would recommend as a great idea to free up space in teen’s room.
customer_reviews.author: R Bernardo

customer_reviews.title: Love This Bed
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I purchased this bed. I put it in a bedroom in my Airbnb and it really opened up the room and allowed me to add a dresser and chair to the room. Im a petite woman and I was able to put this together myself easily, and it took me about 2 hours. Definitely make sure all screws are in very tight and use the two brackets to secure it to the wall or else it will wobble. I used the screws under the bed where the slats are to secure it to the wall on both sides. This is a must.
customer_reviews.author: tina stern

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for adults, cute enough for my girls.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we were looking for. We wanted a bunk bed with a full on bottom so adult guests could sleep there when we have company over. A lot of reviews of other bunk beds said they weren’t very sturdy and a lot weren’t rated for very much weight. This one is perfect. My daughters love it and it is plenty sturdy to sleep two adults on bottoms. Assembly took me several hours which is what I expected. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Scott

customer_reviews.title: VERY UNSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Super rickety. I do not feel like it is a safe bed. When my 9 year old attempted to get into it I thought the entire thing was going to collapse. It shakes horrifcly.
customer_reviews.author: Pclilly6

customer_reviews.title: 10 year old son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 5’2” female and was able to assemble this by myself. It can be secured to the wall (those pieces are not all included) but is sturdy enough without. The ladder is a little uncomfortable on your feet but we covered them with pipe insulation using zip ties. Bed does creak a little but isn’t super noisy. Overall my son loves it! We have 8 ft ceilings and there is plenty of room for him to sit up comfortably without hitting his head.
customer_reviews.author: ProudMommyOf4Boys

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed to open up more space in my son’s room. You’ll definitely need two adults to put it together but once it’s up it pretty sturdy. The only real criticism I have is the ladders to get up. They are thin metal dowels and do not feel good on your feet on the way up. Had I known that, I might have gone a different route but overall it’s a good loft bed for the money.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really nice looking bed. I love the fact that when you sit on the bottom bunk, your head is nowhere near the top. HOWEVER, the squeaking is ridiculously annoying. I can hear my son moving around throughout the night from my room. We are on opposite ends of the hallway. That is the only reason why it does not get 5 stars. Oh, and the bed was super easy to put together. Really easy!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Eh. It's a bed.
customer_reviews.text: Ladder rungs are rough on little feet. Assembly instructions are not great, but bed was easy enough to figure out with basic reasoning skills. My daughter didn't like having to climb over a railing at the end to get into bed so we cut it off. Not the greatest bed but not the worst. Definitely not a long term solution.
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was just a little confusing. I had to redo things sometimes, but it was just because I missed something in the building instructions. I could see how it could be not sturdy, but I really tightened everything up real nice and the bed is very strong. It does wiggle a little, but I chalk that up to the way it is designed, with the bed up high And space below. (Plus my daughter likes to swing on the bars. I don’t regret buying this bed. My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sue Berry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, trendy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this bed. I bought it for my 6 and 4 year old children. It holds up well to their constant climbing and hanging on the rails. It was a chore to assemble, but my oldest child helped and we had it done in about 3 hours. Make sure you have the main support bars for the mattress on correct so the ladder holes are in the right spot before assembling the many pieces for the middle support system.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10yr old who has friends come over. We didn’t want a full time bunk bed so I looked at the twin over futons. I already had a futon mattress as this doesn’t come with mattresses. He loves it. The futon is comfortable enough and easy to recline to a full size bed when needed. Came with extra parts. Takes a while to assemble and you will need two people. But not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Deltatango0321

customer_reviews.title: Worst amazon purchase ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many pieces. The instructions are not clear at all. Pieces were not labeled correctly. I had to reattach parts that were mislabeled. And the instructions are crap crap crap. I scratched up parts of the bed trying to make pieces fit. But now I’m stuck with it. Too much trouble to return and get something easier to assemble. Do not purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not bad to put together at all. Took the wife and I about 2 hours, we took our time. They could do a better job of indicating the ladder and back rail on the second level options. We felt the ladder was lacking and replaced it with something else. Otherwise, great bed. We've been using the top for storage and our daughter sleeps on the bottom. I love the amount of space between the two beds, tall adults can easily sit down without having head room issues. This is the kind of bed that should last the entire childhood so long as you don't let your little monster hang on it like a jungle gym. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDude

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great bed my son loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son who is 14 teen 6” and 160 pounds loves his new bed. We did go ahead and anchored it to the wall. He loves the extra space for sitting a playing he’s guitar. I’m mom and I think it’s pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Amazing room transformation.
customer_reviews.text: It has made my daughters room a preteens dream! My kiddo is so happy with her new bed!! Frees up so much space and gives her a little area that’s unique to her.. The bed arrived a day early, so that was fabulous.. My husband and I put the bed together in 2.5hrs.. It does wobble, but I’ve been on top and it’s pretty sound when you are up there.. the kiddo isn’t bothered by it and once we have it anchored on the wall, I’m sure it’ll be a lot sturdier. It was a great price and our mattress fit it perfectly. We’re pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Porter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, my sixteen year old son put it together in a couple of hours and he loves it! Now he has a gaming/ homework space underneath. Great item! Recommended for higher ceilings as ours are 9 foot, which leaves him ample head room...
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Get Into, But Nice Size
customer_reviews.text: Pretty difficult for our 8 year old son to get into and out of. The steps are very skinny and hurt his feet. He also has to practically hurl himself up into it once he reaches the top because there is no opening up top. Its VERY hard to make the bed. Not made for an adult. Somewhat simple setup. However, I do like the height and available space underneath. Price is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: gmfisher82

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and practical
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yo and I put the bed together ourselves. It was very easy. He agrees that the ladder is tough on feet so I bought the tubing. That works. Yes, a bit wobbly initially; however he was soon over that. A bigger bed than his former twin, my son is enjoying the new bigger size as well as the nook underneath. It’s a nice layout for him. Cozy and practical. One side with the ladders has to stay against a wall because it didn’t align properly no matter what we did. It was simply defective. But the other side is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a bunk bed so we could have a twin on top and queen below. The loft bed fit our needs perfectly. The instructions were a little confusing but I was able to put the bed together almost by myself. My husband just had to help stand it up. My son is thrilled and loves his new bed. Its a bit wobbly climbing up and down but I think that's just because its a loft.
customer_reviews.author: LJH

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware :(
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 full loft beds with workstation. Shipping was faster than expected. However, one set is MISSING ALL screws/washers/wrenches. The manufacturer does not have a phone number, just an email. I filled out the form on their website about the missing hardware and emailed them. I will update when I get a response. This is very disappointing because I really need to set these up for my kids before online schooling starts.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Not Great, Will Work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trundle to fit under my matching twin bunkbeds. I was a bit sad to see that it doesn't quite fit under the frame. If you took out the middle support in the back, it might fit better. I didn't try that since I believe the support is necessary. It's not quite flush, but I don't believe it's a tripping hazard. Also, I strongly suggest a 5-inch twin mattress. Once I assembled the trundle, I realized the recommended mattress size will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Bai

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend loft bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed because I live in a tiny studio and needed more space. It was the best decision. The bed was easy to assemble by myself and arrange in my room. After assembled and mattress was in it did move a little when getting into it exiting out of the bed. I attached mine to the wall to stop that from happening. I would highly recommend this bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: LexiPede

customer_reviews.title: Simple but pactical
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly stable! Two adults can sleep here comfortably. Or not sleep- not too creaky. ;) Some people complained in reviews the ladder is uncomfortable. I can see that, but for me I dont mind. One thing I dont like about this bed is it's too short to stand all the way up under (and I'm only 5'3), which sucks cuz my dressers under it and I have to bend my head down a little. But I guess thats typical of loft beds. I mainly took a star off because it arrived missing one of the ladder rungs. Wasnt a problem for me since I only use one of the ladders, but still came with a piece missing.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fallow instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm super happy with this bed. I got it for my ten-year-old son and he loves it. I was able to put it together in about an hour and a half alone, would have been easier with a second person but I was able to get it done. My only complaint is that some of the bars were not labeled with the number so I had to figure that part out but it didn't take to long.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a 2 person set up, but nothing wrong! Love that a loft bed gives you a little more freedom with storage space. Only downfall I feel like it’s a little wobbly. My son is 8 but super tall. When he comes up and down on this thing it definitely wiggles, gonna have to add the brackets to mount it to the wall and I’m sure that will solve that problem. Overall love this bed!
customer_reviews.author: ipo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Product is just as advertised, sturdy, modern, and easy to assemble. There were only 2 issues to mention 1) there was a manufacturing hiccup with a missing ladder hole and 2) for heavier persons climbing the ladder you will need to add pool noodles to protect your feet. When I was trying to climb the ladder to make the bed my feet hurt really bad on skinny rails. It was hard enough trying to figure out how to make the bed without being on top of it. Overall I'm satisfied with the product for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson. when I visited he was sleeping in the bed. It is easy for him to climb up and get in the bed. Still learning to get out. No way can he roll out. The twin size has enough room for all of his stuffed animals to sleep with him. My son put the bed together by himself. The bed is solid. Lots of room underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine to me
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was ok, im sure it would have been easier if we read the instructions. Two people assembling, one person reading instructions it took about an hour. That includes having to disassembling it because we didn't make sure the posts were aligned properly. Pros- seems sturdy, no rattling, doesn't sway. Very inexpensive. Cons- ladder rungs will hurt feet because they are thin. No cut out in railings, you must climb over railing to get on/off ladder at top
customer_reviews.author: Groovydogg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra dollars vs some other cheaper options.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My oldest kid (7yo) wanted a trundle for their bed for sleepovers. This is very well constructed and fits nicely. It seems like it will last. There were some other cheaper options for trundle frames. This is worth the extra dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend 👌🏻
customer_reviews.text: Loft arrived timely and when it was supposed to. Was decent to set up, but had to set up in the room and was difficult moving around in a small space but not impossible. Its very sturdy and heavy. We were able to fit a queen bed underneath with room on one side for a stand up fan. Id buy again but doubt id have to since it feels well built.
customer_reviews.author: terdar05

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you expect for price point
customer_reviews.text: We've had this bed for about 2 years now and moved it once (from one room to another). For the price it is decent. Every other rung of the ladder is broken and I would defiantly be certiam of ceiling height. If you are looking for extra sturdy I would pay the extra money and go with something else. For us ot will be hitting the curb this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Easy assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and confident that my son will no fall. The bed is very study No movement at all. I have pictures. How ever I can't get the camera to work. My 15 year old daughter put it together. However the bed is for my Son.
customer_reviews.author: Lois  Sawyer-Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaving Spacesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go under my boys bottom bunkbed for sleepovers. Already put some good use to it as my 6 yr old wants to stay with his big brothers and ends up sleeping on it most nights. It’s very sturdy, rolls out easily (even on carpeted floor and for a 6 yr old). All in all this trundle is well made, simple to put together and we are very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gr8erT8er
